str2: Immediately, instantly, at once. From ek and the genitive case singular feminine of autos; from that hour, i.e. Instantly.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: From para and lambano; to receive near, i.e. Associate with oneself; by analogy, to assume an office; figuratively, to learn.
A soldier. From a presumed derivative of the same as stratia; a camper-out, i.e. A warrior.
A centurion of the Roman army. Or hekatontarchos hek-at-on'-tar-khos; from hekaton and archo; the captain of one hundred men.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To run down. From kata and trecho; to run down, i.e. Hasten from a tower.
On, to, against, on the basis of, at.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative Masculine 3rd Person Plural
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: Properly, to stare at, i.e. to discern clearly; by extension, to attend to; by Hebraism, to experience; passively, to appear.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A commander of a thousand men, a military tribune. From chilioi and archo; the commander of a thousand soldiers
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A soldier. From a presumed derivative of the same as stratia; a camper-out, i.e. A warrior.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Middle - 3rd Person Plural
str2: A primary verb; to stop, i.e. Restrain, quit, desist, come to an end.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: To beat, strike, wound, inflict punishment.
Paul, Paulus. Of Latin origin; Paulus, the name of a Roman and of an apostle.
